Lip-reading: I would learn to read lips and mouth movements to understand spoken language.
Sign language: I would learn to use sign language to communicate with others.
Tactile communication: I would use touch to communicate by tapping, pressing, or shaking hands to convey messages.
Using assistive technology: I would use devices such as text-to-speech software or sign language recognition technology to help me communicate.
Using symbols and pictograms: I would use universally recognized symbols and pictograms to convey my thoughts and ideas.
